author: jnosek1
title: ​Are You a Cold-Blooded Netflix Cheater?
text:
Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
You may think you’re a faithful, decent, upstanding gentleman who would never commit adultery or even think about doing your lady dirty. But ah, there’s where you’re wrong. Turns out you’re a cheater without realizing it: Forty-five percent of couples stream their shared TV shows behind each other’s backs , according to survey data via CNET . Netflix and chill? Nay. More like Netflix AND CHEAT! 
The streaming giant found that 61 percent of people who watch shows without their partner—even when they’ve agreed to watch together, those bastards!— don’t fess up to cheating; 68 percent would cheat more if they could get away with it; and 72 percent cheat more than one time. The majority of survey respondents said they cheat because they can’t stop watching and need to know what happens next in the show they’re bingeing, and cheating partners are most likely to sin when their partners are out of town, asleep, and at work. The biggest Netflix temptations, according to the survey: American Horror Story , Archer , Fuller House , Jane the Virgin , and Pretty Little Liars . Advertisement
